intro: Stachyopsis marrubioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stachyopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub with slender, branched stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a strong, mint-like scent, which is a common trait among members of its family. Stachyopsis marrubioides is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
